subject: p19765968
History: Multiple myeloma and pancytopenia, presenting with hypotension, pneumonia.
Findings: PA and lateral views of the chest. A new heterogeneous opacity is seen in the retrocardiac posterior left lower lobe suggestive of early infiltrate. The right lung is clear. The heart size is unchanged. There is no pulmonary edema, pleural effusions or pneumothorax. The cardiac, mediastinal, and hilar contours are normal. The mild compression deformities of two mid thoracic vertebral bodies are stable. No new fractures.
Impression: New left lower lobe early pneumonia. These findings were discussed with Dr. At 11:35 am. On by telephone.
